name: Cincinnati Chili
description: Thank you, Christine Naykki, who inspired and collaborated with us on this product! Cincinnati Chili is a meaty, saucy chili with warming spices like cumin and cinnamon. It’s kind of like a Bolognese, so it makes sense that it’s typically served over spaghetti. Serve it over hot dogs, too—game day, anyone? This makes a big batch (6 cups!) so it’s great for meal planning.
preparation: In a large pot over medium-high heat, combine seasoning with water and tomato paste. Add beef. Using Ground Meat Separator, break beef into small chunks.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Simmer 1–1 1⁄2 hr, or until desired thickness is reached. For a smoother texture, use an immersion blender to thicken.
Serve over spaghetti with additional toppings, if desired.
perfectlyBalanceYourPlate: Serve over 1 cup cooked noodles, with 2 cups leafy greens and 1 tbsp Epicure Dressing on the side.

products.name: Cincinnati Chili Seasoning (Pack of 3)
summary: More of a meaty topping than a traditional stew, Cincinnati Chili is sweet, savoury, and subtly spicy and traditionally served piled on spaghetti with tons of toppings. This one is all about versatility and is served in different “ways.” Try it Two-Way with just the chili topping and spaghetti — this is the base. To make it Three-Way, add cheese, Four-Way, add onions, or Five-Way by adding kidney beans. Any way, it’s sure to be the talk of your next game day gathering or family get-together!
